newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares wobble in early trade.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares wobble in early trade.

text.p: Singapore shares wobbled in early trade on Wednesday. A fall in industrial output and poor IPC results pulled them down at the opening, but then interest in second liners pushed the key index back up, dealers said.

The Economic Development Board attributed the fall in industrial output to a slowdown in the electronics sector, which grew by 2.2 percent in June compared to a 20.7 percent average expansion for the first five months in 1995.
The key Straits Times Industrials Index bounced back from an early form to rise 4.28 points to 2175.73 at 0225 GMT.
First half net profits at computer and electronics firm IPC fell 85 percent to Singapore $5.32 million. IPC was actively traded with 3.03 million shares, down S$0.035 at S$0.495.
Clipsal and Elec & Eltek International fell in sympathy, dropping S$0.04 and S$0.03 respectively.
Causeway Investment was up again on takeover rumours, gaining S$0.06 to S$1.51 on a heavy 2.45 million shares.
Market volume was a thin 17.31 million with advances leading the decliners by 61 to 51.
